problem_text: \odot A and \odot B are congruent. CD is a chord of both circles. If a radius = 13 ft and CD = 10 ft, how long is AB?
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: tan(∠FDA), C on ⊙(A, radius_A), ∠ACD, C on ⊙(B, radius_B), DF, ∠CAD, AD, ∠DAF, F on CD, ∠ACF, 13 = radius_B, AB, 10 = CD, ∠DAC, ∠CDA, 13 = radius_A, ∠FAC, D on ⊙(A, radius_A), CF, AF, ∠DAF, F on AB, BC, AC, CD, ∠FDA

Step 2:
Theorem: Point On Circle Def
Premises : C on ⊙(A, radius_A)
Conclusions: radius_A = AC

Step 3:
Theorem: Point On Circle Def
Premises : C on ⊙(B, radius_B)
Conclusions: radius_B = BC

Step 4:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : F on CD
Conclusions: CD = CF + DF

Step 5:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : F on CD, ∠ACD
Conclusions: ∠ACD = ∠ACF

Step 6:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠DAC
Conclusions: ∠DAC = 2 * pi - ∠CAD

Step 7:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠CDA, F on CD
Conclusions: ∠CDA = ∠FDA

Step 8:
Theorem: Point On Circle Def
Premises : D on ⊙(A, radius_A)
Conclusions: radius_A = AD

Step 9:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : AF, AD, DF
Conclusions: △ADF

Step 10:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠CAD, ∠FAC, ∠DAF
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠CAD + ∠DAF + ∠FAC

Step 11:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : F on AB
Conclusions: AB = AF + BF

Step 12:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : AC, BC, AB
Conclusions: △ABC

Step 13:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : AC, CF, AF
Conclusions: △ACF

Step 14:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : AC, CD, AD
Conclusions: △ACD

Step 15:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : radius_A = AC, 13 = radius_A
Conclusions: 13 = AC

Step 16:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : radius_B = BC, 13 = radius_B
Conclusions: 13 = BC

Step 17:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : radius_A = AC, radius_A = AD
Conclusions: AC = AD

Step 18:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 13 = radius_A, radius_A = AD
Conclusions: 13 = AD

Step 19:
Theorem: Law of Cosines
Premises : △ACD
Conclusions: (AD ** 2 + CD ** 2) - AC ** 2 = 2 * AD * CD * cos(∠CDA), (AC ** 2 + CD ** 2) - AD ** 2 = 2 * AC * CD * cos(∠ACD), (AC ** 2 + AD ** 2) - CD ** 2 = 2 * AC * AD * cos(∠DAC)

Step 20:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 13 = BC, 13 = AC
Conclusions: AC = BC

Step 21:
Theorem: Issoceles Triangle Theorem
Premises : △ACD, AC = AD
Conclusions: CF = DF, AF ⊥ DF, AF ⊥ CF

Step 22:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 10 = CD, 13 = AD, 13 = AC
Conclusions: 18 = (AC + AD + CD) / 2

Step 23:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : ∠CDA = ∠FDA, (AD ** 2 + CD ** 2) - AC ** 2 = 2 * AD * CD * cos(∠CDA), 10 = CD, 13 = AD, 13 = AC
Conclusions: (10 ** 2 + 13 ** 2) - 13 ** 2 = 10 * 13 * 2 * cos(∠FDA)

Step 24:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : ∠ACD = ∠ACF, (AC ** 2 + CD ** 2) - AD ** 2 = 2 * AC * CD * cos(∠ACD), 10 = CD, 13 = AD, 13 = AC
Conclusions: (10 ** 2 + 13 ** 2) - 13 ** 2 = 10 * 13 * 2 * cos(∠ACF)

Step 25:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 13 = AC, 10 = CD, 13 = AD, (AC ** 2 + AD ** 2) - CD ** 2 = 2 * AC * AD * cos(∠DAC)
Conclusions: (13 ** 2 + 13 ** 2) - 10 ** 2 = 13 * 13 * 2 * cos(∠DAC)

Step 26:
Theorem: Issoceles Triangle Theorem
Premises : AC = BC, △ABC
Conclusions: AF ⊥ CF, AF = BF

Step 27:
Theorem: Side-Side-Side Congruent Theorem
Premises : CF = DF, AC = AD
Conclusions: △ACF ≅ △ADF

Step 28:
Theorem: Sin Function Definition
Premises : ∠FDA, △ADF, AF ⊥ DF
Conclusions: AF / AD = sin(∠FDA)

Step 29:
Theorem: Angle Tan Definition
Premises : tan(∠FDA), AF ⊥ DF
Conclusions: AF / DF = tan(∠FDA)

Step 30:
Theorem: Cos Function Definition
Premises : △ADF, AF ⊥ DF, ∠DAF
Conclusions: AF / AD = cos(∠DAF)

Step 31:
Theorem: Sin Function Definition
Premises : △ACF, ∠ACF, AF ⊥ CF
Conclusions: AF / AC = sin(∠ACF)

Step 32:
Theorem: Tan Function Definition
Premises : △ACF, ∠ACF, AF ⊥ CF
Conclusions: AF / CF = tan(∠ACF)

Step 33:
Theorem: Solve Univariate Equation
Premises : (10 ** 2 + 13 ** 2) - 13 ** 2 = 10 * 13 * 2 * cos(∠FDA)
Conclusions: 1.18 = ∠FDA

Step 34:
Theorem: Solve Univariate Equation
Premises : (10 ** 2 + 13 ** 2) - 13 ** 2 = 10 * 13 * 2 * cos(∠ACF)
Conclusions: 1.18 = ∠ACF

Step 35:
Theorem: Solve Univariate Equation
Premises : (13 ** 2 + 13 ** 2) - 10 ** 2 = 13 * 13 * 2 * cos(∠DAC)
Conclusions: 0.79 = ∠DAC

Step 36:
Theorem: Congruent Definition
Premises : △ACF ≅ △ADF
Conclusions: AC = AD, ∠DAF = ∠FAC

Step 37:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 1.18 = ∠FDA
Conclusions: 0.92 = sin(∠FDA), 2.4 = tan(∠FDA)

Step 38:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 1.18 = ∠ACF
Conclusions: 2.4 = tan(∠ACF), 0.92 = sin(∠ACF)

Step 39:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DAC = 2 * pi - ∠CAD, 0.79 = ∠DAC
Conclusions: 0.79 = 2 * pi - ∠CAD

Step 40:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 0.92 = sin(∠FDA), AF / AD = sin(∠FDA)
Conclusions: 0.92 = AF / AD

Step 41:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2.4 = tan(∠FDA), AF / DF = tan(∠FDA)
Conclusions: 2.4 = AF / DF

Step 42:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : AF / CF = tan(∠ACF), 2.4 = tan(∠ACF)
Conclusions: 2.4 = AF / CF

Step 43:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : AF / AC = sin(∠ACF), 0.92 = sin(∠ACF)
Conclusions: 0.92 = AF / AC

Step 44:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : ∠DAF = ∠FAC, 0.79 = 2 * pi - ∠CAD, 2 * pi = ∠CAD + ∠DAF + ∠FAC
Conclusions: 0.39 = ∠DAF

Step 45:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : AF / AD = cos(∠DAF), 0.39 = ∠DAF, 13 = AD, AF = BF
Conclusions: cos(0.39) = BF / 13

Step 46:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 0.92 = AF / AD, 0.92 = AF / AC, cos(0.39) = BF / 13, 2.4 = AF / CF, CD = CF + DF, 2.4 = AF / DF, AB = AF + BF, 18 = (AC + AD + CD) / 2
Conclusions: 24 = AB
